types.name: Query
types.description: Query your grading report

fields.name: getReport
fields.description: Get the data given by a GIA grading report

fields.name: getQuota
fields.description: Check your quota, does not consume a report request from your quota

types.name: GradingReport
types.description: The base grading report object

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date diamond was examined by GIA

fields.name: report_date_iso
fields.description: Date diamond was examined by GIA, in ISO-8601 format

fields.name: report_number
fields.description: Unique GIA report number registered in GIA's database

fields.name: report_type
fields.description: The type of GIA report

fields.name: report_type_code
fields.description: The type of GIA report, in machine-readable format

fields.name: results
fields.description: The grading results as shown on the GIA report

fields.name: links
fields.description: Links to other files, such as images and PDFs

fields.name: quota
fields.description: Quota remaining after this report is returned

fields.name: info_message
fields.description: Any special information regarding your report request, for example if your original requested report has been updated to a different report number

fields.name: is_digital
fields.description: If report is part of digital program

types.name: String
types.description: Built-in String

types.name: ReportTypeCode
types.description: Machine-readable report type codes

types.name: ReportResults
types.description: The structure of report results varies by the type of report

types.name: DiamondGradingReportResults
types.description: Results for core grading services such as Dossier, Diamond Grading, and Colored Diamond Grading.

fields.name: shape_and_cutting_style
fields.description: The outline of the diamond shape and the pattern of the facet arrangement cutting style.

fields.name: measurements
fields.description: Diamond dimensions listed as 'minimum diameter – maximum diameter x depth' for round diamonds and 'length x width x depth' for fancy-shaped diamonds.

fields.name: carat_weight
fields.description: Diamond dimensions listed as 'minimum diameter – maximum diameter x depth' for round diamonds and 'length x width x depth' for fancy-shaped diamonds.

fields.name: color_grade
fields.description: The absence of color ranging from colorless to light yellow or brown for diamonds on the D-Z scale. The color grade in terms of hue, tone, and saturation for diamonds on the colored diamond grading scale.

fields.name: color_origin
fields.description: States whether color is natural or treated. In rare cases, color determination may not be possible and is reported as undetermined. Available on specific report types such as colored diamond reports only.

fields.name: color_distribution
fields.description: Evenness or unevenness of color seen face-up using standard viewing procedures. Available on specific report types such as colored diamond reports only.

fields.name: clarity_grade
fields.description: The relative absence of inclusions and blemishes. Graded on a scale from Flawless to Included based on size, nature, number, position, and relief of characteristics visible under 10x magnification.

fields.name: cut_grade
fields.description: For standard, D-to-Z color, round brilliant diamonds. Cut grade incorporates the aspects of face-up appearance, design, and craftsmanship.

fields.name: m2m_rough_data
fields.description: M2M data and media

fields.name: polish
fields.description: Smoothness of the diamond’s surface, assessed on a scale ranging from excellent to poor.

fields.name: symmetry
fields.description: Smoothness of the diamond's surface, assessed on a scale ranging from excellent to poor.

fields.name: fluorescence
fields.description: Strength and color of the diamond when viewed under long-wave ultraviolet light. A fluorescence description of 'none' represents a range of fluorescence from indiscernible to very faint.

fields.name: clarity_characteristics
fields.description: List of the most significant clarity characteristics present in the diamond that justifies the clarity grade. Available on Dossier reports only.

fields.name: key_to_symbols
fields.description: List of clarity characteristics plotted on the diagram. Available for Diamond Grading and Colored Diamond Grading reports.

fields.name: inscriptions
fields.description: Any text, symbols, logos, or a unique GIA report number inscribed on the diamond.

fields.name: report_comments
fields.description: Additional identifying characteristics or features that are not otherwise represented on the report. If a treatment is detected, such as laser drilling, it would be described here.

fields.name: proportions
fields.description: The diamond's proportions, as shown in the proportion diagram

fields.name: data
fields.description: Additional data fields in machine-readable format

types.name: ClarityCharacteristic
types.description: A clarity characteristic listed in the key to symbols.

fields.name: order
fields.description: The sort order for this characteristic

fields.name: characteristic
fields.description: The clarity characteristic description

fields.name: symbol
fields.description: Symbol

fields.name: location
fields.description: The location of the clarity characteristic

types.name: Int
types.description: Built-in Int

types.name: DiamondProportions
types.description: Parameters available on the proportion diagram if any.

fields.name: depth_pct
fields.description: Table-to-culet depth, expressed as a percentage of average girdle diameter for round shapes or width for fancy shapes.

fields.name: table_pct
fields.description: Table size expressed as a percentage of a round brilliant's average girdle diameter for round shapes or width for fancy shapes.

fields.name: crown_angle
fields.description: The average of the angles of the bezel facet planes relative to the table planes. Available for RBC only.

fields.name: crown_height
fields.description: Measurement from the table plane to the intersection of the bezel facet with the girdle. Available for RBC only.

fields.name: pavilion_angle
fields.description: Average of the angles formed by the pavilion main facet planes and the girdle plane. Available for RBC only.

fields.name: pavilion_depth
fields.description: Measured from the girdle to the culet, then expressed as a percentage of average girdle diameter. Available for RBC only.

fields.name: star_length
fields.description: Length of star facets expressed as a percentage of the total distance between the girdle and the edge of the table facet. Available for RBC only.

fields.name: lower_half
fields.description: Length of lower-half facets expressed as a percentage of the total distance between the girdle and the culet. Available for RBC only.

fields.name: girdle
fields.description: Thickness of the intersection of the crown and pavilion which defines the perimeter of the diamond.

fields.name: culet
fields.description: Size of the facet at the tip of a gemstone relative to the average diameter for round shapes or width for fancy shapes.

types.name: DZColorGrade

fields.name: color_modifier
fields.description: Color modifier

types.name: DZColorGradeCode
types.description: D-Z Color Grades

types.name: ClarityGradeCode

types.description: Machine-readable cut grade codes

types.name: PearlIdentReportResults
types.description: Pearl Identification Tabular Format

fields.name: report_title
fields.description: This is based on the current report format as of 10/20/2018. This does not include quanitity or drilling. The title of the report

fields.name: weight
fields.description: "Weight of the pearls being identified In grams for mounted or strung pearls. In carats for cultured loose pearls. Or in carats and grains for natural loose pearls.

fields.name: measurements
fields.description: In millimeters. Diameter measurement for round or spherical shapes. Length x width x depth for other shapes. For multiple pearls, a range of measurements from maximum to minimum is listed.

fields.name: shape
fields.description: Describes the shape of the pearls being identified.

fields.name: bodycolor
fields.description: Describes the overall color of the pearl.

fields.name: overtone
fields.description: Any single noticeable translucent color that overlies the bodycolor. Includes orient - multiple overlying colors or a form of iridescence that appears to be on or just below the surface. Not all pearls display overtone or orient.

fields.name: identification
fields.description: Identification

fields.name: environment
fields.description: Environment in which the pearl was created: freshwater or saltwater.

fields.name: mollusk
fields.description: The genus and species of the source mollusk.

fields.name: treatment
fields.description: Indicates any detectable treatments.

fields.name: report_comments
fields.description: Additional identifying characteristics or features that are not otherwise represented on the report.

types.name: NarrativeReportResults
types.description: The narrative report format is used on some gem identification reports.

fields.name: report_title
fields.description: The title of the report

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the item

fields.name: conclusion
fields.description: The identification conclusion

fields.name: report_comments
fields.description: Additional identifying characteristics or features that are not otherwise represented on the report. If a treatment is detected, such as laser drilling, it would be described here.

fields.name: inscriptions
fields.description: Any text, symbols, logos, or a unique GIA report number inscribed on the diamond.

types.name: MeleeServiceResults
types.description: The GIA Melee Analysis Service separates natural, untreated diamonds from simulants, synthetic and HPHT treated natural diamonds, and sorts the screened diamonds by color range.

fields.name: packages
fields.description: Array of packages included in the Melee Analysis service

types.name: MeleeServicePackage
types.description: The GIA Melee Analysis Service separates natural, untreated diamonds from simulants, synthetic and HPHT treated natural diamonds, and sorts the screened diamonds by color range.

fields.name: service_results_number
fields.description: Service results number

fields.name: issue_date
fields.description: Date of issue

fields.name: melee_shape
fields.description: The outline of the items when viewed face up.

fields.name: diameter
fields.description: Dimension range for the items in this package, measured in millimeters. Listed as 'minimum diameter – maximum diameter'.

fields.name: total_carat_weight
fields.description: Total weight of items in this package given in carats, recorded to the nearest hundredth of a carat.

fields.name: color_range
fields.description: The color range of the items in this package. A D-to-Z color grade describes the absence of color ranging from colorless to light yellow or brown when compared to GIA Master Color Comparison Diamonds.

fields.name: number_of_items
fields.description: The count of items contained in this package.

fields.name: material_test_results
fields.description: Describes the material tested in this package.

fields.name: comments
fields.description: Additional identifying characteristics or features that are not otherwise represented.

types.name: IdentificationReportResults
types.description: The tabular report format is used on most gem identification reports.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Weight given in carats, recorded to the nearest hundredth of a carat. One carat is equal to 1/5 of a gram.

fields.name: measurements
fields.description: Diamond dimensions listed as 'minimum diameter – maximum diameter x depth' for round diamonds and 'length x width x depth' for fancy-shaped diamonds.

fields.name: shape
fields.description: Description of the outline of the gemstone.

fields.name: cutting_style
fields.description: Description of the outline of the gemstone.

fields.name: transparency
fields.description: Description of the degree to which the gemstone allows light to pass through it.

fields.name: color
fields.description: General description of the color.

fields.name: item_description
fields.description: Description of the mounted item and additional information.

fields.name: species
fields.description: Gem category based on chemical composition and crystal structure.

fields.name: treatment
fields.description: Treatments identified.

fields.name: report_comments
fields.description: Additional identifying characteristics or features that are not otherwise represented on the report.

types.name: Links
types.description: Links to supplementary files, such as PDFs and images.

fields.name: pdf
fields.description: Report facsimile in PDF format.

fields.name: proportions_diagram
fields.description: Graphic profile representation of the diamond's actual proportions.

fields.name: plotting_diagram
fields.description: Plotting diagram with symbols to indicate the type or nature, position, and the approximate size of a clarity characteristic.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Digital image of the item.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Built-in Boolean

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema SDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar SDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface SDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum value SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field SDL definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

directives.name: defer
directives.description: This directive allows results to be deferred during execution

directives.name: aws_iam
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by sigv4 signing.

directives.name: aws_publish
directives.description: Tells the service which subscriptions will be published to when this mutation is called. This directive is deprecated use @aws_susbscribe directive instead.

args.name: subscriptions
args.description: List of subscriptions which will be published to when this mutation is called.

directives.name: aws_auth
directives.description: Directs the schema to enforce authorization on a field

args.name: cognito_groups
args.description: List of cognito user pool groups which have access on this field

directives.name: aws_api_key
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by an API key.

directives.name: aws_subscribe
directives.description: Tells the service which mutation triggers this subscription.

args.name: mutations
args.description: List of mutations which will trigger this subscription when they are called.

directives.name: aws_oidc
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by an OIDC token.

directives.name: aws_cognito_user_pools
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by a Cognito User Pools token.

args.name: cognito_groups
args.description: List of cognito user pool groups which have access on this field
